data.title: 30 of the Most High-Profile Celebrity Divorces of All Time
data.meta_description: Celebrity divorces have a way of dominating headlines for days, maybe even weeks and months. Here, a look back at some of the most high-profile divorces.
data.text:
Jenna Dewan and Channing Tatum: 2018

Dewan and Tatum first met in 2006 on the set of their dance flick Step Up. The couple then tied the knot in 2009, and welcomed their daughter, Everly, in 2013. In April 2018, they released a statement announcing their divorce after nearly nine years of marriage.

Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux: 2018

The two actors first met in 2007 while on the set of Tropic Thunder and, soon after, reunited on the 2011 set of Wanderlust. Afterwards, they began dating, and went on to get engaged in 2012. Aniston and Theroux enjoyed a long engagement, but eventually tied the knot in 2015 at a private ceremony in Bel Air. After two and a half years of marriage, they announced their separation in February of 2018.

Usher and Grace Miguel: 2018

The singer and Miguel started dating in 2009, shortly following Usher's previous divorce from first wife, Tameka Foster. He proposed to Miguel in 2015. Following almost 10 years together, and two and a half years of marriage, the couple eventually separated in March 2018.

Johnny Depp and Amber Heard: 2017

Depp and Heard met on the set of The Rum Diary in 2011. They began dating in 2014 after Depp separated with longtime girlfriend Vanessa Paradis. They became engaged the same year, and were married in the Bahamas in 2015. In May 2016, Heard filed for a restraining order and a divorce, citing physical and verbal abuse. Their divorce was finalized on January 13, 2017. Heard received a $7 million settlement, all of which she donated to charities supporting victims of domestic violence.

Ben Stiller and Christine Taylor: 2017

The two actors met in 1999 on the set of a television series and they fell fast. They married the following year on May 13, 2000 in Kauai. After 17 years and two kids, they seemed destined to last. However, on May 25, 2017, they sadly announced their divorce. However, this is one split that didn't stick, and in an interview with Esquire published in February 2022, the Zoolander actor shared that he and Taylor were back together after they decided to move back in with each other at the onset of the pandemic.

Chris Martin and Gwyneth Paltrow: 2016

Gwyneth Paltrow famously referred to their divorce as a “conscious uncoupling.” After ten years of marriage and two children, they divorced on July 14, 2016. Distance and grueling work schedules were cited as factors in the split.

Kaley Cuoco and Ryan Sweeting: 2016

The Big Bang Theory star married the tennis pro after six months of dating in 2013. The marriage lasted 21 months. They divorced on May 6, 2016. Kaley Cuoco later revealed that Ryan Sweeting had become addicted to prescription painkillers and was making no effort to get sober, leading to the demise of their union.

Kris and Caitlyn Jenner: 2015

After marrying in 1991, the couple added two children of their own to their brood of eight children from their previous marriages. They separated on June 1, 2013 and their divorce was finalized on March 23, 2015. Following the divorce, Caitlyn began her public transition from life as Bruce to life as Caitlyn.

Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck: 2015

With ten years of marriage and three children, Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner seemed destined to last. They met on the set of Pearl Harbor in 2000 and became romantically involved in 2004 after both had split from their previous partners. They married in a destination wedding in Turks and Caicos in 2005. They divorced in 2015 amid rumors of Affleck having an affair with the couple's nanny.

Miranda Lambert and Blake Shelton: 2015

They met in 2005 when they performed a duet together at a concert for Country Music Television. Blake Shelton was still married to his first wife Kaynette Gern at the time, and they didn't begin dating until after his divorce in 2006. They had no children, but they did have 15 rescue pets. Toward the end of their ten year union, rumors of infidelity on both sides. Their divorce was finalized in 2015.

Heidi Klum and Seal: 2014

The supermodel and singer wed in Mexico in 2005, and romantically renewed their vows yearly on their anniversary. They had three children during their nearly ten-year marriage. They divorced in 2014, as rumors swirled that Seal partied hard and had a problem controlling his temper, while Seal accused Heidi Klum of having an affair with her bodyguard.

Mariah Carey and Nick Cannon: 2014

Mariah Carey began dating Nick Cannon in 2008, and they got married the same year in a secret ceremony in the Bahamas. They welcomed twins Moroccan and Monroe on April 30, 2011. In the years to come, however, they grew apart and ended up divorcing December of 2014.

Heather Mills and Paul McCartney: 2008

After six years of marriage, Sir Paul split from Mills and it sure wasn’t pretty. They fought a very public battle in the tabloids, and she ended up with around $48.6 million after having requested nearly five times that amount.

Guy Ritchie and Madonna: 2008

The Material Girl married director Ritchie in 2000, and they broke up nearly eight years later. They share a son, Rocco, and reportedly split because, as Madonna said in 2012, the marriage “[wasn’t] what I thought it was going to be.”

Ryan Phillippe and Reese Witherspoon: 2007

If you’ve ever seen the movie Cruel Intentions, you will realize why this sudden divorce was particularly devastating. Sweethearts Phillippe and Witherspoon met when they were in their early 20s and married shortly thereafter. They were together nearly eight years before calling it quits.

Kid Rock and Pamela Anderson: 2007

Pamela Anderson and Kid Rock had an on-again, off-again relationship that started in 2001 when they met backstage at a VH1 Divas concert. The relationship was definitely on in July of 2006 when they spontaneously tied the knot on a yacht. The bride wore a white bikini and the groom wore a white tee shirt. Just 122 days later, however, they divorced.

Renée Zellweger and Kenny Chesney: 2005

Back in 2005, Renée Zellweger married country singer Kenny Chesney on the Caribbean island of St. John in the U.S. Virgin Islands. They had met during NBC’s Concert of Hope tsunami telethon, and tied the knot after five months of dating; four months after the marriage, Zellweger had it annulled, citing "fraud" on Chesney's part.

Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston: 2005

These two seemed to really have it all. They were madly in love, incredibly successful as actors, and members of Hollywood’s most beautiful people list. Sadly, after marrying in a lavish ceremony in Malibu five years earlier, the pair divorced in 2005. The alleged the reason was Pitt’s infidelity with Jolie on the set of Mr. & Mrs. Smith.

Meg Ryan and Dennis Quaid: 2001

Ryan and Quaid’s divorce was like a real-life rom-com disaster in the public eye. In 2000, reports surfaced that Ryan was having an affair with her Proof of Life costar Russell Crowe. Ryan and Quaid have a son, Jack, who was 8 at the time of the split.

Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman: 2001

The couple met on the set of Days of Thunder in 1989. They were married by December of 1990. Kidman was 23 and Cruise was 28. During their marriage they starred in several films together and adopted two children together. Cruise filed for divorce in February 2011. It is widely believed the divorce was due to pressure from the Church of Scientology.
